intro: Chamaeiris lilacina, commonly known as the pink-flowered chamaeiris, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, lilac-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
